DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the validity of pulse pressure variation to predict fluid responsiveness in patients undergoing robotic or laparoscopic gastrectomy.
DOC.brief_title: The Utility of Pulse Pressure Variation to Predict the Fluid Responsiveness During Pneumoperitoneum and Reverse-Trendelenburg Position
DOC.criteria: adult patients aged over 19 years who are scheduled for robotic or laparoscopic gastrectomy cardiac arrhythmia valvular heart disease ischemic heart disease left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40% Pulmonary disease esophageal disease upper gastrointestinal bleeding Body mass index more than 40 kg/m2.
